intro: Bupleurum swatianum, commonly known as Swat Bupleurum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Pakistan and northern India. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its medicinal properties have been studied for their potential anti-inflammatory and antioxidant effects. Bupleurum swatianum is also valued in traditional medicine for its use in treating various ailments.
